title: Bug 13725 - Revert is much slower than close and reopen in java editor.
description: Bug 13725 - Revert is much slower than close and reopen in java editor.
OB: When opening an editor on the file org.eclipse.swt.custom.StyledText.java in the Eclipse SWTCustom Widgets project in the org.eclipse.swt repository, selecting 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor takes about 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original.
EB: Selecting 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor should be as fast as closing and reopening the editor window, which takes about 8 seconds in total.
SR:
1) Open an editor on the file org.eclipse.swt.custom.StyledText.java.
2) Select the end of the first line and enter a space character to mark the file as dirty.
3) Click on the close box in the editor tab and choose 'no' when prompted to save changes.
4) Double-click on the file in the navigator to reopen it.

Or:

1) Open an editor on the file org.eclipse.swt.custom.StyledText.java.
2) Select the end of the first line and enter a space character to mark the file as dirty.
3) Right-click on the editor window and select 'Revert' from the pop-up menu.
